Class MatrixOp

java.lang.Object
heparansulfate.MatrixOp
public class MatrixOp extends Object
Provides static methods for common matrix and vector operations.

This class includes utilities for printing, matrix multiplication, transposition, and solving linear systems using Cholesky factorization.

  • Method Details

    • printMat

      public static void printMat(double[][] mat)
      Prints a matrix to the standard output.
      Parameters:
      mat - The matrix to print.

    • printMatS

      public static void printMatS(double[][] mat, double eps)
      Prints a symbolic representation of a matrix.

      Entries with absolute values less than or equal to eps are printed as ".", while other entries are printed as "x".

      Parameters:
      mat - The matrix to print.
      eps - The threshold value below which an entry is considered zero.

    • getMatStringRep

      public static String getMatStringRep(double[][] mat)
      Returns a String representation of a matrix.
      Parameters:
      mat - The matrix to convert.
      Returns:
      A tab-delimited string representation of mat.

    • getVecStringRep

      public static String getVecStringRep(double[] x)
      Returns a String representation of a vector.
      Parameters:
      x - The vector to convert.
      Returns:
      A string representation of vector x.

      public static void printVec(double[] x)
      Prints a vector to the standard output.
      Parameters:
      x - The vector to print.

    • transpose

      public static double[][] transpose(double[][] a)
      Returns the transpose of the given matrix.
      Parameters:
      a - The input matrix.
      Returns:
      The transposed matrix a^T.

    • getL2Norm

      public static double getL2Norm(double[] x)
      Computes the squared L2 norm of a vector.
      Parameters:
      x - The input vector.
      Returns:
      The value of x^T x.

    • multMatVec

      public static double[] multMatVec(double[][] a, double[] b)

      b - The input vector.
      Returns:
      The product vector c = ab.

    • multMat

      public static double[][] multMat(double[][] a, double[][] b)

      Parameters:

      b - The second matrix.
      Returns:
      The product matrix c = ab.

    • cholesky

      public static double[][] cholesky(double[][] A)
      Performs the Cholesky factorization of a symmetric and positive-definite matrix A.

      Decomposes A into A = LL^T, where L is a lower triangular matrix with positive diagonal elements.

      Parameters:
      A - The input matrix (must be symmetric and positive definite).
      Returns:
      The lower triangular Cholesky factor L.

    • forwardElimination

      public static double[] forwardElimination(double[][] a, double[] b)
      Solves a linear system ax = b where the matrix a is lower triangular using forward elimination.
      Parameters:
      a - A lower triangular matrix.
      b - The constant vector.
      Returns:
      The solution vector x.

    • backwardSubstitution

      public static double[] backwardSubstitution(double[][] a, double[] b)
      Solves a linear system ax = b where the matrix a is upper triangular using backward substitution.
      Parameters:
      a - An upper triangular matrix.
      b - The constant vector.
      Returns:
      The solution vector x.

    • choleskySolve

      public static double[] choleskySolve(double[][] a, double[] b)
      Solves the linear system ax = b for a symmetric and positive-definite matrix a.

      This method uses Cholesky factorization followed by forward elimination and backward substitution.

      Parameters:
      a - Symmetric and positive-definite matrix.
      b - The constant vector.
      Returns:
      The solution vector x.

    • geInnerProd

      public static double geInnerProd(double[] x, double[] y)
      Computes the inner product (dot product) between two vectors.
      Parameters:
      x - First vector of dimension n.
      y - Second vector of dimension n.
      Returns:
      The scalar value sum_{i=1}^n x_i * y_i.
